Dwarf.Description: Dwarves are known for their ancient grandeur, deep mines, blazing forges, commitment to clan and tradition, and a fierce hatred of goblins and orcs.
Dwarf.Age: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans but are considered young until they reach the age of 50. They live about 350 years on average.
Dwarf.Alignment: Most dwarves are lawful and tend toward good, with a strong sense of fair play and belief in a just order.
Dwarf.Size: Medium (stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds)
Dwarf.Speed: 25 feet (not reduced by wearing heavy armor)
Dwarf.Darkvision: You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. Only shades of gray are discernible in darkness.
Dwarf.Dwarven Resilience: Advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.
Dwarf.Dwarven Combat Training: Proficiency with battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
Dwarf.Tool Proficiency: Proficiency with one set of artisan's tools (smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools).
Dwarf.Stonecunning: Proficiency in Intelligence (History) checks related to the origin of stonework, with double proficiency bonus.
Dwarf.Languages: Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds.

Hill Dwarf.Description: Hill dwarves possess keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience.
Hill Dwarf.Dwarven Toughness: Hit point maximum increases by 1, and by 1 every time you gain a level.

Mountain Dwarf.Description: Mountain dwarves are strong and hardy, accustomed to rugged terrain, and tend toward lighter coloration.
Mountain Dwarf.Dwarven Armor Training: Proficiency with light and medium armor.
